Early and intense wildfire season has arrived around the Mediterranean
description: As of July 8, some 214,000 hectares have been ravaged by flames in the European Union, more than double the average. Fires have broken out further north in Europe, and the eastern Mediterranean region has also been struck.

Netanyahu 'deeply' expresses regret after Israeli strike hits Gaza church, killing three and wounding priest
description: An Israeli strike on the only Catholic church in Gaza killed three people on Thursday, church officials said, and wounded 10 others, including a priest who was close to the late Pope Francis.

headline: Indonesia calls Trump a 'tough negotiator' after reaching an agreement with the US
description: The country has presented the deal as an honorable outcome, while further diversifying its economic and strategic partnerships with the rest of the world.

headline: Tour de France continues its anti-doping fight amid persistent suspicion
description: 600 samples will be collected during the three weeks of the race. Despite increased resources, the International Testing Agency does not believe the entire peloton can truly  be considered clean.

headline: In 1945, 'Elle' instantly set a new standard for French women's magazines
description: 'The Summer of 1945' (4/6). Hélène Gordon-Lazareff, who spent much of World War Two in the United States, returned to France with fresh ideas for the press. She promised her readers 'seriousness in frivolity, irony in gravity.'

description: The video was filmed in Rafah, nearly 900 meters from a Gaza Humanitarian Foundation aid distribution center. According to the United Nations, over 800 people have been killed in Gaza since the end of May while trying to access humanitarian aid.

headline: Russia is facing a labor shortage
description: The Russian economy is set to need 10 million workers by 2030 – a challenge made more daunting as the country's demographic decline accelerates, worsened by the human losses from the war in Ukraine.

headline: 'Soldiers found us and told us to undress': In Ethiopia, silence shrouds Tigray war's mass rapes
description: During the war in Tigray, in Ethiopia, 120,000 women were victims of rape. More than two and a half years since the end of the conflict, many survivors are still trying to overcome their trauma, with justice yet to be served.
